definition:
A net $(x_a)_{a\in A}$ on a set $X$ is said to be an [**ultranet**]{} or
[**universal net**]{} if whenever $E\subseteq X$, $(x_a)$ is either
eventually in $E$ or eventually in $X\smallsetminus E$.

[**:**]{}

-   It can be shown that every net has a universal subnet.

-   When $X$ is a locally compact topological space, a universal net in
    $X$ is either convergent or it “goes to ” (it eventually leaves
    every compact subset).
